abstract: Dr Matthew Skinner study in journal Science suggests that human ancestors developed hands suitable for holding tools 3.2 million years ago, 600,000 years earlier than previously thought.
lead_paragraph: Human ancestors developed hands that were better suited to holding tools than climbing trees up to 600,000 years earlier than previously thought.
snippet: Human ancestors developed hands that were better suited to holding tools than climbing trees up to 600,000 years earlier than previously thought.

headline.main: Study Suggests Earlier Use of Tools by Hominids
headline.print_headline: Archaeology: Study Suggests Earlier Use of Tools by Hominids
